title: Woodshop News - October 2013 (gnv64)
description:
Woodshop News - October 2013
English | PDF | 68 pages | 49 mb

Features
34 COMING OF AGE: Andrew Marques is only 24 and his recent purchase Cove Woodworking in Gloucester, Mass., means he hopes to be in business for the long haul.
40 A CONNECTION TO THEIR CREATIONS: Mark Richey Woodworking in Massachusetts prides itself not only on quality products, but also on training quality woodworkers.
45 TIME IS ON YOUR SIDE: An investment in CNC equipment can boost your bottom line and save dozens of man hours in the process..

News Desk
9 Jet invests in Tennessee community shop.
10 Irwin Tools focuses on trade contributions.
12 Maine trade group honors family business.
16 Wagering a guess on woodworker salaries.
28 WOOD MARKETS: Mighty oak a solid performer.

Columns
20 FINISHING: Epoxy sticks. By Greg Williams
22 PRO SHOP: The art of reasoning. By David Getts

Tools & Techniques
19 Powermatic debuts new PM1000 table saw.
19 General offers router extension kit for table saws.
20 Bostitch selling new compressor in combo kits.
21 SuperMax Tools goes big with open-end drum sander.
